result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Michael Affolter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erik Michael Affolter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erik Michael Affolter was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.
Civil judgment for unpaid restitution. Joint and several with co defendant's Travis D Westaby (Pierce County 14CF153) and Jason Lee Schmitz (Dunn County 14CF277)

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Joint and Several with 14CF153 (Travis Westaby) and 14CF277 Dunn County Case (Jason Lee Schmitz)

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations.
Comply with all provisions of probation.
Complete any specific programming determined by Agent.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered a total of $2612.52 for restitution and court costs. Clerk obtained a print out from DOC and the amount should be $2488.11. Clerk of Courts does not collect the Restitution and Non-Restitution surcharge, which total $124.41.

Court orders time served. Civil judgnent in the aoumount of $ 2612.52 of costs and restitution  The breakdown for the amount is in the PSI.  Appeal  rights are given to the defendant.

10:39 a.m.  Defendant Erik Michael Affolter in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Mark Wolf.  Wolf is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Wolf.  Froelich - Exhibit #1 - estimate of damages on ATV.  Off/Rec.  Exhibit #2 - Belt for ATV.  Off/Rec.  Exhibit #3 - Impound Fee.  Off/Rec.  Exhibit #4 - Sprayer replacement. Off/Rec.  Yonko cross-examines Wolf.  Froelich does redirect.  Exhibit #5 - photo of ATV prior to theft.  Exhibit #6 - Photo of ATV after theft.  Off/Rec.  Yonko calls Erik Affolter.  Affolter is sworn and takes the stand.  Yonko examines Affolter.  Yonko gives argument.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $1,970.11.  DA to prepare order.
Defendant's JOB. Return to Sender; Not deliverable as addressed.
Restitution hearing at 02-29-2016 10:30 am.

4:04 Defendant Erik Michael Affolter in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich does not have any changes on PSI. Yonko: page 5 on PSI, Defendant states that offense is not him. Page 6 2para; 7 times on probation not 10. Only corrections and changes. Froelich: victims rights have been complied with. Bond by PSI and requests 3 years probation: conditions restitution joint and several. requests 2 weeks for final amount. Yonko requests PSI sentence recommendations and a restitution hearing. Defendant addresses the court. Court: S/W 3 years probation. conditions: maintain sobriety, court costs and DNA surcharge, restitutions, comply with any conditions, and any specific programming.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 12-14-2015 03:30 pm.
from Probation/Parole Agent Sadie Zolnik requesting a sentencing date further out to complete the PSI, has been unable to meet with Def based on health issues.

Sentencing hearing at 11-16-2015 10:30 am.

8:56 a.m.  Defendant Erik Michael Affolter in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froilich - plea to Ct. 1, PSI, restitution - $1,970.11 joint and several.  Moves to dismiss Ct. 2.  Yonko addresses the court.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    Court reviews probation requirements with defendant. Mr. Afolter does have prior military service.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct. 1.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Court dismisses Ct. 2.  Court orders PSI.  See JA for date for sentencing hearing approximately 60 days out.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.
Plea hearing at 09-10-2015 08:30 am.
from Atty Yonko re: parties have reached an agreement. Remove jury trial from calendar and set for plea in late October.
